text: The study of economics IS Important to every society because it______

options.A: Enables individuals to satisfy all their wants
options.B: Helps in the utilization of scarce resources.
options.C: Helps producers to know what to produce.
options.D: Restores equilibrium between producers and consumers

text: A consumer with $10 needs a dress, a pair of shoes, a handbag and jewelry costing $20, $10, $7 and $3 respectively. The opportunity cost of buying the pair of shoes Is the________
The distinguishing function of an entrepreneur is_______
When a commodity market operates without government interference, commodities are distributed through_______
One way of obtaining the median of a given data is to__________

options.A: Sum the value and divide by the number of items.
options.B: Arrange the data in ascending order and subtract each item from the mean.
options.C: Arrange the data in descending order and add each item to the least.
options.D: Arrange the data in either ascending or descending order and find what item divides the set in two equal parts.

explanation: To find the median, first order the numbers from smallest to largest. Then find the middle number. For example, the middle for this set of numbers is 5, because 5 is right in the middle: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 9.

text: An increase in the rice harvest, all things being equal, may cause____________

options.D: Farmer's incomes to be more than doubled

text: The demand for wood and labour is an example of______
What will be the reaction of consumers in a market if there is a fall in the price of the substitute commodity X?

options.A: Price of commodity X will increase
options.B: Demand for the substitute of commodity X will decrease
options.C: Demand for commodity X will decrease
options.D: Supply of both commodity X and its substitute will increase.

text: An increase in market supply is caused by the following factors except_________

options.A: An improvement in innovation and technology.
options.B: An increase in the price of the commodity
options.C: A reduction in the cost of raw materials.

text: The coefficient of price elasticity of supply of land is usually____________
The price of soap rose from $10 to $20 causing a trader to increase her supply from 50 to 120 boxes per week. This makes supply_________
The leftward shift in the supply curve for a commodity indicates_________
explanation: A leftward or an inward shift in the supply curve means a decrease in supply. When the supply curve shifts to the left, it causes prices to rise and the quantity to decrease.

text: Market supply may increase if there is an increase in the________
Government can increase farmers' incomes by__________

options.C: Encouraging them to produce surplus output.

text: When market supply increases , the equilibrium price_________
The supply of mangoes is represented as P=0.3Q, where P is the price ($) and Q is the quantity. What is P when Q is 50?
The output of an extra unit of an input is referred to as________
explanation: The marginal product of an input is the extra output that results from adding one unit of the input to the existing combination of productive factors.

text: The law of diminishing returns is applicable to the__________

options.C: plants and machinery of the firm.

options.D: school leaving age and number of part-time workers

text: Non-economic factors that influence the location of firms include ________

options.A: the existence of required materials for production
options.C: adequate supply of power, good road and rail network
options.D: the activities of politicians in deciding location of firms

text: Which of the following is not an argument for the policy of privatization in West Africa?

options.B: Government is able to participate and control the operation of the privatized businesses
options.C: Members of the public are able to acquire shares
options.D: It encourages the inflow of capital and expertise from local and foreign sources

text:
Use this data below to answer the question
The following data relates to the national income of a country.
Gross domestic product = $2800
Net factor income from abroad = $250
Depreciation = $700
Indirect taxes = $120
 
What is the country's Gross National (GNP)?

Use this data below to answer the question
The following data relates to the national income of a country.
Gross domestic product = $2800
Net factor income from abroad = $250
Depreciation = $700
Indirect taxes = $120
 
What is the country's Net National Product (NNP) at factor cost?
explanation:
NNP at factor cost is the net money value of all the goods and services produced by residents of a country plus net factor income from abroad.
Therefore NNP at FC = 2800 + 250 - (120 + 700)
3050 - 820 = 2230

text: The standard of living in two countries can be compared using the___________

options.A: number of industries in each country
options.B: size of their arms and ammunition
options.C: size of their national incomes only

text: Government can curb inflation by_________

options.A: encouraging banks to lend for any purpose.
options.C: buying treasury bills in the open market.
options.D: selling securities in the open market

explanation:
One of the ways through which inflation can be controlled is through open market operation. This involves the buying or selling of government securities.
When there is excess money in circulation leading to inflation, the federal government, through the central bank, sells securities to the public to mop out the excess money in circulation. That is, the government invites the public to invest in its treasury bills, government bonds.

text: Functions of money does not include_______
Demand-pull inflation can be as a result of___________

options.A: increase in the cost of production.

explanation:
Demand-pull inflation is when there is an increase in aggregate demand, and the supply remains the same or decreases.
Demand-pull inflation can be caused by an expanding economy, increased government spending, or overseas growth.

options.A: Allow the currency to appreciate to encourage imports.
options.B: Allow the currency to depreciate to encourage imports

options.D: Increasing taxes on all locally produced goods

text: If a country imposes a barrier on trade, the resultant effect will be _________

options.B: high quality goods from local industries
options.C: an increase in the demand for locally produced goods

text: A country may be able to earn more from exports if she_____________

options.A: free movement of factors of production

text: Balance of payments and trade problems that arose after the world wars were resolved by the____________

options.A: International Bank tor Reconstruction and Development.

text: Examples of land that are non-renewable include___________

options.C: some natural resources such as natural gas.

text: Abundant natural resources do not contribute to economic growth in developing countries because of_________
